authors.name: Masayuki K. Sakata
authors.affiliation: Graduate School of Human Development and Environment, Kobe University, Kobe, Japan

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"e0mre","text":"Variations of this standardised protocol have been used by Masayuki K. Sakata and colleagues to successfully extract fish eDNA from modern and historic Japanese lake and river sediments. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74cj0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aeiij","text":"The method has been used to recover fish species composition data from modern surface sediments from a lake (Sakata et al., 2020) and a small, natural river (Sakata et al., 2021). It has also been applied to detect target fish species in lake sediments up to 100 years old (Sakata et al., 2022).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8l0kr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmgrg","text":"This extraction method represents a consolidation of the methods applied in the following publications:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23ehk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bth19","text":"Sakata, M.
